item.title: Report E-2024110235
item.description:
Report E-2024110235

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-30
  • City: DES PLAINES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) ounces of product released from one (1) 19-liter jerrican, impacting the trailer floor. Personnel cleaned release using absorbents and generated two (2) poly drums of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110223
item.description:
Report E-2024110223

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-24
  • City: Rockford
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifty (50) pounds of Azodicarbonamide released from one (1) fifty (50) pound plastic bag. The release was due to a loading error by a previous terminal, which caused the box to tear and damaged the bag inside of it. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the spill and generated one (1) twenty (20) gallon poly drum of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110212
item.description:
Report E-2024110212

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-05
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 5, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed absorbent pads to the paint-impacted trailer. All spent absorbent pads, impacted wrap, PPE, and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum, and one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was collected and containerized into one (1) overpack drum.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED PACKAGE CONTAINED 4 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF GOLD ASSASSIN RTU IN WHICH 1 BOTTLE LEAKED AT THE CLOSURE. THE REMAINING BOTTLES GOT CONTAMINATED SO ENTIRE CONTENTS GOT PROCESSED THRU DMP.
